spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall massing roughly resembles the 2D plan (central living/dining with bedrooms around), but multiple spatial mismatches exist. (E2/E4) Bedroom-to-toilet/deck relationships are not consistently preserved (top-right suite area appears simplified). (E1/E2) Several small rooms (multiple toilets + HO) are not clearly represented as distinct enclosed spaces, altering circulation. (E2/E3) Door locations/orientations are not faithfully matched (many openings appear generic without matching the 2D door positions and swings). (E2) Window placements from the plan (numerous exterior windows) are largely absent/unclear in the 3D model. (E4) Room proportions look compressed/normalized (living/dining and kitchen/utility appear re-proportioned compared to the labeled dimensions).

structural_fidelity.notes: Structural partitioning is simplified relative to the plan. (E1) Not all toilets shown in 2D are represented as separate enclosed bathrooms in 3D (plan indicates multiple: Toi-1, Toi-4, C.Toi, and an additional small toilet). (E1) HO (home office) room is not clearly present as a distinct room. (E2) Adjacency fidelity is weakened where service core partitions (toilets/utility/HO) are merged or rearranged. (E6) Wall thickness/door embedding appears inconsistent (some openings read as gaps without proper framed doors). (E5) Some internal wall runs/corridor edges appear added/reshaped to suit the 3D layout rather than matching the 2D partition geometry.

furniture_mapping.notes: Major furniture types exist (beds, living seating, dining table, kitchen counters), but mapping to the exact 2D arrangement is approximate. (E2) Living/dining furniture placement does not clearly match the plan’s layout (sofa/TV/center table positioning differs). (E4) Scale consistency is mixed: several rooms appear to use similarly sized bed/furniture footprints despite differing room dimensions in the plan.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric presentation is generally clean with acceptable lighting and readability, but it is not a strict architectural/orthographic match. (E6) Some geometry reads softened/simplified (edges and openings not crisply defined). Camera is broadly isometric but not perfectly orthographic-accurate relative to the plan. Overall composition is clear, but fidelity issues reduce technical quality.

detected_errors.description: Missing/unclear representation of multiple bathrooms shown in the 2D plan (Toi-1, Toi-4, C.Toi, and the additional small toilet are not all distinctly enclosed in 3D).
HO (home office) room shown near the bottom-center of the 2D plan is not clearly present as a separate room in the 3D render.
Door placement does not match the 2D plan; several openings appear generic and not located where the plan indicates (notably around the service core and bedroom entries).
Door orientations/swing directions are not preserved; 3D openings lack the specific hinge/swing logic shown in the 2D plan.
Window placement from the 2D plan (numerous exterior windows) is largely missing or not identifiable in the 3D render.
Proportions of key spaces (living/dining vs. kitchen/utility and some bedrooms) appear normalized/compressed compared to the 2D plan’s labeled dimensions.
Hallucinated/reshaped internal partitions and corridor edges appear in 3D where the 2D plan shows different wall runs, indicating structural reinterpretation rather than faithful translation.
Rendering/geometry simplification: inconsistent wall thickness cues and door embedding; some openings read as gaps without proper frames.
